chapter.title: Work Order (W/O) Module
chapter.para:
In this chapter, we describe the Manufacturing module. This is the module where Work Orders are created, maintained, and executed. A work orders
five states of Work Order is an authorization to perform manufacturing activities. The following topics will be covered:

listitem.para: Work Order Material Requirements
Work Order Operations
Work Order Control
Pick Lists
Material and Labor Variance Reports
Shop Floor Workbench

section.title:
work order control
work orders
controlling
work orders
relation to production W/O Control
section.para: A Work Order is a document which authorizes the production of manufactured Items. Work Orders can exist in five different states--from creation to completion. The five different states of Work Orders are listed below:

listitem.para: Open ("O"): This is the initial state a Work Order receives when it is first created.
Exploded ("E"): A Work Order is considered exploded once it has been opened and its accompanying Work Order Material Requirement and Work Order Operations have also been created.
Released ("R"): This state describes a Work Order that has been released to the shop floor.
In-process ("I"): This is the state a Work Order reaches when Work Order Material Requirements have been issued to it.
Closed ("C"): The final state of a Work Order occurs when it is closed.

section.para: The creation and control of Work Orders is handled by the "W/O Control" section.

section.title: Shop Floor Workbench
section.para: The Shop Floor Workbench offers enhanced labor tracking and streamlined Work Order processing for either Operations or Production posting environments. Its built-in Time Clock functionality ensures precise run-time reporting. Workbench users are required to clock-in to and clock-out of Work Orders.

note.para: The clock-in requirement applies only to Shop Floor Workbench users. If you don"t use the Workbench, no clock-in is required.

section.para: To access the Shop Floor Workbench, select the "Shop Floor Workbench" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: The Shop Floor Workbench must be configured for either Operations posting or Production posting. You may not use the Workbench for both methods simultaneously. To configure the method used by the Shop Floor Workbench, use the Configure W/O screen in the System module.

section.para: When accessing the Shop Floor Workbench, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the name of the user wanting to clock-in or clock-out of a Work Order.
Once a username is entered, the display at the bottom of the screen will show all the Work Orders the user is currently clocked-in to.

tip.para: At the system level, you can restrict a user's privileges so the Shop Floor Workbench is the only interface they see when they log in to the application.

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order the user wants to clock-in to or clock-out of.
Only released "R" and in-process "I" Work Orders may be processed using the Shop Floor Workbench.

note.para: A Work Order must be released "R" before users may clock-in or clock out. The release of a Work Order occurs after the Work Order has been exploded.

listitem.para: Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Only released "R" and in-process "I" Work Orders may be processed using the Shop Floor Workbench.
If the Workbench is configured for Operations-posting, select an Operation from the list of Operations.

Users are required to clock-in and clock-out of individual Operations. This allows run-time calculations to be performed on an Operation-by-Operation basis. A user may be clocked-in to multiple Operations simultaneously. Also, multiple users may be clocked-in to the same Operation. Whatever the case, the run-time clock starts when a user(s) clocks in to an Operation, and it stops when the user(s) clocks out.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without clocking-in or clocking-out, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to clock-in to the specified Work Order.

When a user clocks-in to a Work Order, the run-time clock starts running from that point. The clock stops when a user clocks-out of the Work Order. The elapsed time--or "effort"--is used for labor reporting purposes. Users may only clock-in to Work Orders they are not already clocked-in to. However, users may clock-in to and clock-out of the same Work Order as many times as necessary. Each clock-in starts the run-time Time Clock; each clock-out stops it.
Select to clock-out of the specified Work Order.

When selected, the run-time clock stops for the specified Work Order. The time elapsed since the user last clocked-in is added to the run time total for the Work Order. This run-time calculation is automatic and cannot be overridden--except by users who have override privileges. Users may only clock-out of Work Orders they are already clocked-in to. If the Workbench is configured for Operations-posting, the "Post Operations" screen will be presented immediately after the CLOCK OUT button is selected. By default, the "Scrap Work Order Material from W/O" screen will immediately follow the "Post Operations" screen.

tip.para: Shop Floor Workbench users should only scrap top-level Items after they have posted production sufficient to cover the scrap quantity. For example, if a user assembles 10 top-level Items successfully but significantly damages the 11th, the user should post a quantity of 11 produced and then scrap one (i.e., 11 - 1 = 10).

listitem.para: If the Workbench is configured for Production-posting, the Post Production screen will be presented immediately after this button is selected. The button will be hidden if the Workbench is configured for Operations-posting.

section.title:
work orders
creating new Create New Work Order
section.para: To create a new Work Order, select the "Create New Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When creating a new Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Next available Work Order Number will automatically display, unless your system requires you to enter Work Order Numbers manually.
Default values and input parameters for Work Order Numbers are configurable at the system level.
Enter the Item Number of the manufactured Item you want to create a Work Order for.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Specify supplying Warehouse for selected Item.
Only Warehouses that contain supplying Item Sites for the selected Item may be chosen.

note.para: Order Parameters may have an impact on Work Order quantity if the "on Manual Orders" option is selected in the Item Site master for a manufactured Item. If Order Parameters are in effect, the Work Order must conform to those restrictions. Both Minimum Order size and Order Multiple may be governed by Order Parameter settings.

listitem.para: Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99.
Value entered assigns a priority to the selected Work Order. By assigning a priority to a Work Order, you can indicate the relative importance of a Work Order in comparison to other Work Orders.
Value entered specifies the number of Item units to be processed by the Work Order.
Enter the date the Work Order must be completed by.
Enter the date the Work Order must be started by. By default, this date will be the due date less the Lead Time. The start date may be changed by altering the Lead Time field.

varlistentry.term:
work orders
adjusting lead times for Lead Time (Days)

listitem.para: Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 999.

Value entered specifies the manufacturing Lead Time required between the date the Work Order starts and the date it is due. Lead Times for Items are specified in the Item Site master, but may be modified on this screen.

note.para: The option to associate a Project with a Work Order will only be visible if your site is configured to use Projects.

listitem.para: Select a Project Number to associate with the Work Order.

If the Work Order was created from Sales Order demand--and the parent Sales Order had a Project Number associated with it--then the Project Number from the parent Sales Order will automatically be entered here. In this way, Sales Orders and Work Orders may be linked to the same Project.

This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering production Notes related to the Work Order. Production Notes are printed on Pick Lists and Packing Lists for reference by production personnel.

tip.para: If a Work Order was created from a Sales Order, the Production Notes field will contain the Sales Order Number, the Customer Name, and any additional Sales Order Line Item Notes.

listitem.para: Select to print a Work Order Traveler when Work Order is created.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating the Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Creates the Work Order.

section.para: To view Comments related to a Work Order, select the "Comments" tab. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Work Order Comments may not be added at the time of Work Order creation. Instead, use the Production Notes tab for entering Notes related to a Work Order.

section.para: When viewing Comments related to a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Display lists Comments for the specified Order.

section.title:
explosion
of work orders
work orders
explosion of Explode Work Order
section.para: When a Work Order is exploded, Work Order Material Requirements and Work Order Operations are created for the Work Order in question, using the Bill of Materials and Bill of Operations for the parent Item. To manually explode a Work Order, select the "Explode Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Work Orders can be exploded either manually or automatically by default. The default setting is configured at the system level.

section.para: When manually exploding a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to explode.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable Work Order list featuring open Work Orders ready for explosion.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.

note.para: Default Work Order explosion levels can be configured at the system level.

varlistentry.term:
work orders
explosion levels for Level

listitem.para: Select one of the following Work Order explosion levels:

Single Level Explosion: During a single-level explosion, Work Order Material Requirements and Work Order Operations are created for the parent Item--but not for any manufactured components of the parent Item. The Work Orders for manufactured components must be exploded manually.

Multiple Level Explosion: In a multiple-level explosion, any manufactured components of the parent Item are identified and Work Orders are created for them. Then, Work Order Material Requirements and Work Order Operations are created for both the parent Item and the manufactured components.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without exploding the selected Work Order and returns you to the application desktop.
Explodes the selected Work Order.

section.title:
work orders
implosion of
implosion
of work orders Implode Work Order
section.para: When you implode a Work Order, you delete the Work Order's Material Requirements and Work Order Operations. Only Work Orders with exploded ("E") Status can be imploded. If the Work Order has been released ("R") or is in-process ("I"), it may not be imploded. Implosion changes a Work Order's Status from exploded ("E") back to open ("O"). To implode a Work Order, select the "Implode Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:
When imploding a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to implode.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without imploding the Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Implodes the Work Order.

section.title:
work orders
closing of Close Work Order
section.para: A Work Order can be closed at any point. To close a Work Order, select the "Close Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Work Order Materials and Operations history is saved in the database after a Work Order is closed. Reports can be written to retrieve this information.

section.para: When closing a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to close.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.

varlistentry.term:
variances
relation to w/o
work orders
variances related to Post Material Usage Variances

listitem.para: Material Usage Variances: Select to post material usage variances resulting from the Work Order.
Variance information can be found in the Work Order reports.
Select to post labor variances resulting from the Work Order.
Variance information can be found in the Work Order reports.
Select to attach a Comment to the Work Order.
This option must be selected if you want to add a Comment to the Work Order.
Specify one of the following Comment Types from the drop-down list: ChangeLog or General.

Comment Types are used to categorize Comments. Once you have specified a Comment Type, you may type your Comment in the main text area. The text area features word-wrapping and scroll-bar support for longer Comments.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without closing the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Closes the selected Work Order.

section.title:
travelers
printing of Print Traveler
section.para: A Traveler is a collection of printed documents which accompanies a Work Order. Traveler documents may include the Pick List, Routing, or Packing List. To print a Work Order Traveler, select the "Print Traveler" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing a Traveler, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to print a Traveler for.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select to release the Work Order. Selecting this option causes the Work Order Status to change from exploded ("E") to released ("R").
Select the documents you want to print.

Select to print a Pick List. A Pick List is a printed list showing the Work Order Material Requirements for a specified Work Order. Not selecting means a Pick List will not be printed with the Traveler.

tip.para: At least one of the document options must be selected for the PRINT button to be enabled.

listitem.para: Select to print a Routing. A Routing is a list showing the Work Order Operations for a specified Work Order. Not selecting means a Routing will not be printed with the Traveler.

note.para: The Routing pulls its information from the list of Work Order Operations for the Work Order Item, not from the Item's Bill of Operations.

listitem.para: Select to print a Packing List. This option is only enabled when a Work Order is driven by a Sales Order. The option is not available for manually generated Work Orders. Not selecting means a Packing List will not be printed with the Traveler.

Select to print Work Order Labels. If selected, the quantity of Work Order Labels printed will equal the quantity of Items ordered by the Work Order. Not selecting means Work Order Labels will not be printed with the Traveler.

note.para: By default, the system will print Work Order Labels in the same quantity as the quantity ordered by the Work Order. If you want to print fewer than the quantity ordered, use the "Print Work Order Form" option.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing any Traveler paperwork, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title:
pick lists
printing of Print Pick List
section.para: A Pick List is a printed list showing the Work Order Material Requirements for a specified Work Order. To print a Pick List, select the "Print Pick List" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing a Pick List, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to print a Pick List for.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99.
Specify the number of copies of the Pick List you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing a Pick List for the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title: Print Routing
section.para: A Routing is a list showing the Work Order Operations for a specified Work Order. To print a Work Order Routing, select the "Print Routing" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing a Work Order Routing, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose Routing you want to print.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99.
Specify the number of copies of the Work Order Routing you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing a Routing for the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title:
work orders
releasing by planner code
planner codes
releasing work orders by Release Work Orders by Planner Code
section.para: If multiple Work Orders within a Planner Code have been exploded, you have the option of releasing them simultaneously. To release Work Orders by Planner Code, select the "Release Work Orders by Planner Code" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Release Work Orders by Planner Code

note.para: Once an Order has been released, the system considers the ordered quantity to be available at 00:00:01 of the due date of the Order in question.

section.para: When releasing Work Orders by Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to release Work Orders for all Planner Codes.
Specify Planner Code whose exploded Work Orders you want to release.
Enter a Planner Code pattern to select a range of Planner Codes.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
All relevant Work Orders exploded prior to the date entered will be released.
Select to make cutoff date effective as of Work Order start date.
Select to make cutoff date effective as of Work Order due date.
Select to release Work Orders by Planner Code from all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose exploded Work Orders by Planner Code you want to release.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without releasing Work Orders by Planner Code, returning you to the application desktop.
Releases Work Orders by Planner Code, using the specified parameters.

section.title: Reprioritize Work Order
section.para: You have the ability to reprioritize Work Orders having either "O" or "E" status. To change the priority assigned to a Work Order, select the "Reprioritize Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When rescheduling a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to reschedule.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays the current priority assigned to the Work Order.
Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99.
Value entered assigns a new priority to the selected Work Order.
Select to reprioritize child Work Orders to meet the demands of the reprioritized parent Work Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without reprioritizing the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Assigns a new priority to the selected Work Order.

section.title:
work orders
rescheduling of Reschedule Work Order
section.para: Only exploded ("E") Status Work Orders can be rescheduled. Released ("R") Work Orders must first be recalled to an Exploded state before they may be rescheduled. To reschedule an exploded Work Order, select the "Reschedule Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When rescheduling a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to reschedule.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Indicate the rescheduled Work Order start date. The current start date will be displayed.
Indicate the rescheduled Work Order due date. The current due date will be displayed.
Select to reschedule child Work Orders to meet the demands of the rescheduled parent Work Order.
Select to attach a Comment to the Work Order.
This option must be selected if you want to add a Comment to the Work Order.
Specify one of the following Comment Types from the drop-down list: ChangeLog or General.

Comment Types are used to categorize Comments. Once you have specified a Comment Type, you may type your Comment in the main text area. The text area features word-wrapping and scroll-bar support for longer Comments.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without rescheduling the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Reschedules the selected Work Order according to the new start and due dates entered in the screen.

section.title:
work orders
changing quantities for Change Work Order Quantity
section.para: You have the ability to change the quantity of Work Orders having either "O" or "E" status. To change the quantity specified by a Work Order, select the "Change Work Order Quantity" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When changing a Work Order's quantity, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose quantity you want to change.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Enter the revised Work Order quantity in the "New" field. The current quantity ordered will display under the "Current" column.
The current quantity received will display under the two columns.
The current quantity balance will display under the two columns.
Select to attach a Comment to the Work Order.
This option must be selected if you want to add a Comment to the Work Order.
Specify one of the following Comment Types from the drop-down list: ChangeLog or General.

Comment Types are used to categorize Comments. Once you have specified a Comment Type, you may type your Comment in the main text area. The text area features word-wrapping and scroll-bar support for longer Comments.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without changing the selected Work Order's quantity ordered, returning you to the application desktop.
Changes the selected Work Order quantity to the new Work Order quantity specified in the "New" field.

section.title:
work orders
purging closed Purge Closed Work Orders
section.para: When you purge closed Work Orders, you are removing from the database both detailed and header level Work Order information. To purge closed Work Orders, select the "Purge Closed Work Orders" option. The following screen will appear:
When purging closed Work Orders, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: All closed Work Orders prior to the date entered will be purged from the system.
Select to purge closed Work Orders from all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose closed Work Orders you want to purge.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without purging closed Work Orders, returning you to the application desktop.
Purges closed Work Orders using the criteria specified in the screen.

section.title:
work order material requirements
creation and management of
work orders
material requirements for W/O Materials
section.para: Work Order Material Requirements can be created and managed in this section.

note.para: If your system is configured to automatically explode Work Orders at creation, Work Order Material Requirements will also be created automatically at explosion.

section.title:
work orders
creating material requirements for Create W/O Material Requirement
section.para: To create a Work Order Material Requirement for an open ("O") Work Order, select the "Create W/O Material Requirement" option. The following screen will appear:
When creating a Work Order Material Requirement, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to create a Material Requirement for.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Enter the Item Number of the Item you want to add to the parent Item's Bill of Materials.
This feature allows you to add Items to the selected Work Order's list of Material Requirements on an ad hoc basis.
Inventory Unit of Measure.

Enter the quantity of component Items required to produce one of the Items manufactured by the selected Work Order. The component Item is measured in its Inventory UOM. The Item manufactured by the Work Order is measured in that Item's Inventory UOM.
Enter the estimated Scrap percentage for the ad hoc addition.
Required: Displays the total quantity required, including quantity per and Scrap allowance.
Select one of the available issue methods:
Push: Select if you want material for the Item to be issued to the Work Order by a specific material issue transaction.
Pull: Select if you want material for the Item to be issued to the Work Order by either a material backflush or an Operation backflush.
Mixed: Select if you want the Item to take upon itself the issue method applied to it initially--that is, either a pull or a push.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating a new Work Order Material Requirement, returning you to the application desktop.
Creates the Work Order Material Requirement.

section.title:
work orders
deleting material requirements from Delete W/O Material Requirement
section.para: To delete a Work Order Material Requirement, select the "Delete Work Order Material Requirement" option. The following screen will appear:
When deleting a Work Order Material Requirement, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to delete a Material Requirement from.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select one of the component Items from the parent Item's Bill of Materials.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Per: Displays the quantity per each specified on the Item's Bill of Materials.
Displays the Scrap percentage specified on the Item's Bill of Materials.
Required: Displays quantity required to fulfill the Work Order Material Requirement.
Issued: Displays quantity issued toward fulfillment of the Work Order Material Requirement.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without deleting the selected Work Order Material Requirement, returning you to the application desktop.
Highlight a component Item and then select this button to delete the selected Work Order Material Requirement.

section.title:
work orders
maintenance of materials in
work order material requirements
maintenance involving Maintain W/O Material Requirements
section.para: To maintain Work Order Material Requirements, select the "Maintain W/O Material Requirements" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: If you are using the "Substitute" option found on the right-click menu, keep in mind that this utility applies only to BOM-defined Substitutions, as specified on the Bill of Materials for the Item in question.

section.para: When maintaining Work Order Material Requirements, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose Material Requirements you want to maintain.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Display lists Material Requirements associated with specified Work Order.
If the due date is past due, the date will display in red.
Displays the total number of component Items which are also Pick List Items.
Items may be marked as Pick List Items on the Item master.
Displays the total number of component Items which are not Pick List Items.
Displays the total number of component Items.
Displays the current Standard Cost for the component Items.

The displayed Cost includes all Standard Costs associated with the component Items. Any non-material Costs associated with manufactured subcomponents (e.g., Labor and Overhead) would also be included in this total.
Displays the current Actual Cost for the component Items.

The displayed Cost includes all Actual Costs associated with the component Items. Any non-material Costs associated with manufactured subcomponents (e.g., Labor and Overhead) would also be included in this total.
Displays the maximum desired Cost for the component Items.
The maximum desired Cost is defined on the Item master. It provides a visual guide to help determine whether component Item Costs--either Standard or Actual--have exceeded the maximum desired Cost.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Opens screen for creating a new Work Order Material Requirement.

Enables you to edit highlighted Material Requirements. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Operation--except that when editing, the fields will contain Operation information. Double-clicking on a Requirement will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Material Requirement and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight a Material Requirement and then select this button to remove the Operation from the list.
You may not delete Material Requirements which have materials issued against them. If materials have been issued, the Requirement may not be deleted.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Requirement in the Operations list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
work orders
issuing materials in batch mode
batch mode
issuing w/o materials in
work order material requirements
issuing in batch mode Issue W/O Material Batch
section.para: To issue Work Order Material Requirement Items simultaneously in a batch, select the "Issue W/O Material Batch" option. The following screen will appear:
When issuing Work Order Material Requirement Items in a batch, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose component Items you want to issue in a batch.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Work Order Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.

varlistentry.term: Issue Items not on Pick List

listitem.para: Select to indicate that non-Pick List Items should be backflushed as well.
Display lists Work Order Material Requirements.

The display is color-coded for ease of use. If an Item's issue method is "Pull," then that Item--and the entire row it sits on--will appear in blue type. The blue type indicates that the batch issue utility will not affect these Items. By definition, pulled Items are backflushed, not issued. However, if an Item's issue method is "Push," then that Item--and the row it sits on--will appear in black type. Rows with black type are affected by the batch issue utility. One other color may also appear. If the quantity required by the Work Order exceeds the Quantity on Hand--meaning there is an Inventory shortage--the value in the "Short" column will display in red.

note.para: If you are issuing Lot/Serial Items to a Work Order, these cannot be issued automatically from a default Location. You must individually select and then distribute the desired Lot/Serial quantity.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without issuing any materials to the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Issues all pushed Work Order Material Requirements for the selected Work Order.

section.title:
work orders
issuing materials individually
work order material requirements
issuing individually Issue W/O Material Item
section.para: To issue Work Order Material Items individually, select the "Issue W/O Material Item" option. The following screen will appear:
When issuing Work Order Material Items individually, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose individual component Item you want to issue.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select one of the specified Item's component Items whose issue method is "Push" or "Mixed."

note.para: If the "Comp. Item Number" list contains no component Items, this means that the issue method for all the component Items is "Pull." Only Items with the issue method of "Push" or "Mixed" will appear in the menu.

listitem.para: Inventory Unit of Measure.
The total quantity of the component Item required by the Work Order will be displayed.
The total quantity of the component Item issued to the Work Order to date will be displayed.
to Issue: Enter the quantity of the component Item you want to issue to the Work Order.
Total Quantity on Hand prior to the issue will be displayed.
Total Quantity on Hand after the proposed issue will be displayed.

note.para: If you are issuing Lot/Serial Items to a Work Order, these cannot be issued automatically from a default Location. You must individually select and then distribute the desired Lot/Serial quantity.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without issuing any of the selected component material to the selected Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Issues the component Item in the quantity specified.

section.title:
work order material requirements
returning in batch mode
batch mode
return w/o materials using
work orders
return material batch from Return W/O Material Batch
section.para: To return Work Order materials to Inventory simultaneously in a batch, select the "Return W/O Material Batch" option. The following screen will appear:
When returning Work Order materials to Inventory simultaneously in a batch, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose materials you want to return to Inventory simultaneously in a batch.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without returning Work Order materials to Inventory, bringing you back to the application desktop.
Returns the Work Order's materials to Inventory simultaneously in a batch.

section.title:
work order material requirements
returning individually
work orders
return material item from Return W/O Material Item
section.para: To return Work Order materials to Inventory individually, select the "Return W/O Material Item" option. The following screen will appear:
When returning Work Order materials to Inventory individually, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose materials you want to return to Inventory individually.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select one of the individual component Items for the specified Item.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displayed value represents the quantity of the component Item required per parent Item.
Displayed value represents the allotted Scrap percentage for the component Item when manufacturing the parent Item.
Required: Displayed value represents the quantity required to fulfill the specified Work Order.
Issued: Displayed value represents the quantity issued in fulfillment of the specified Work Order.
to Return: Enter the amount of the component Item to be returned to Inventory.
Total Quantity on Hand prior to the issue will be displayed.
Total Quantity on Hand after the proposed issue will be displayed.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without returning the Work Order component Item to Inventory, returning you to the application desktop.
Returns the material for the specified component Item to Inventory.

section.title:
scrap
from w/o materials Scrap W/O Material from W/O
section.para: To scrap Work Order Materials which have been specifically issued to a Work Order using a Material Issue transaction, select the "Scrap W/O Material from Work Order" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Scrap Work Order Material from Work Order

tip.para: You may only scrap W/O Materials which have been specifically issued to a Work Order. In other words, Material Requirements having the Push issue method may be scrapped.

section.para: When scrapping Work Order Materials from a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose materials you want to scrap.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select if you want to scrap parent-level Items.

Enter the quantity of top-level finished Items you want to scrap. You may scrap top-level Items after they have been received into Inventory--or before. Keep in mind that if you scrap top-level Items prior to receiving them, material requirements for those Items may or may not have been issued to the Work Order yet. You should make any necessary adjustments to account for those requirements. For example, you may need to issue the components--either manually or through a material backflush--and then scrap them retroactively.

tip.para: Shop Floor Workbench users should only scrap top-level Items after they have posted production sufficient to cover the scrap quantity. For example, if a user assembles 10 top-level Items successfully but significantly damages the 11th, the user should post a quantity of 11 produced and then scrap one (i.e., 11 - 1 = 10).

listitem.para: Select if you want to scrap component Items issued to the Work Order.
Select one of the component Items from the parent Item's Work Order Material Requirements will be listed.

note.para: You may scrap component Items regardless of their issue method. However, components must first be issued to a Work Order before they can be scrapped from it. Components are issued to Work Orders either manually or through a material backflush.

listitem.para: Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays the component quantity per each specified on the parent Item's Work Order Material Requirements.
Displays the component scrap percentage specified on the Item's Bill of Materials.
Displays the component quantity required to fulfill the Work Order Material Requirements.
Displays the component quantity currently issued to the Work Order. You may only scrap components which have already been issued to a Work Order--either manually or through a material backflush.
Displays a running total of the component quantity already scrapped--if any.

tip.para: You may not scrap the full quantity of a Work Order Material Requirement from a Work Order.

listitem.para: Enter the quantity of the component Item you want to scrap from the Work Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without scrapping the material from the Work Order.
Scraps the specified quantity of the component Item from the Work Order.

section.title:
production
posting of Post Production
section.para: Work Order progress can be posted in terms of materials used or Operations completed. When you post production, you are using the materials-driven process for reporting progress. To post production for a Work Order, select the "Post Production" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Post Production for a Work Order

section.para: When posting production for a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose production you want to post.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Display the quantity of the component Item required per parent Item.
Received: Displays the quantity required to fulfill the specified Work Order.
Displays the quantity issued in fulfillment of the specified Work Order.
to Post: Enter the quantity of the component Items you want to post.
Select to indicate that the amount of materials indicated by the associated Work Order Material Requirement record will be issued to the selected Work Order for all "Pull" or "Mixed" component Items.

varlistentry.term: Issue Items not on Pick List

listitem.para: Select to indicate that non-Pick List Items should be backflushed as well.
Select to indicate that the amount of time and labor indicated by the associated Work Order Operation record will be issued to the selected Work Order.
Enter the name of the user who performed the set up.
Enter the name of the user who performed the production run.

note.para: If the "Backflush Operations" option is not selected, the setup and run time options will be disabled.

listitem.para: Select to close the Work Order after posting.
If you are posting partial production and want to keep the Work Order open, you should not select this option.
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering production posting Notes related to the Work Order.
Select to transfer Work Order production to specified Warehouse. Specify the Warehouse you want to transfer production to.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without posting production for the Work Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Posts production for the Work Order in the amount specified.
Select to open the "Scrap Work Order Material from W/O" screen.

section.title:
production
correcting posting of Correct Production Posting
section.para: To correct production posting for a Work Order--in the event, for example, that production has been previously overstated--select the "Correct Production Posting" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: You may not post a correction to a Work Order that manufactures a Breeder Item. Instead, you must manually adjust the Quantity on Hand values for the Breeder materials, the Co-Products, and the By-Products.

section.para: When correcting production posting for a Work Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose production posting you want to correct.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays the quantity of the component Item required per parent Item.
Received: Displays the quantity required to fulfill the specified Work Order.
Displays the quantity issued in fulfillment of the specified Work Order.
to Correct: Enter the corrected amount of the production to be posted.
Select to indicate that the amount of materials indicated by the associated Work Order Material Requirement record will be issued to the selected Work Order for all "Pull" or "Mixed" component Items.

varlistentry.term: Return Items not on Pick List

listitem.para: Select to indicate that the non-Pick List Items should be backflushed as well.
Select to indicate that the amount of time and labor indicated by the associated Work Order Operation record will be issued to the selected Work Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without correcting production posting, returning you to the application desktop.
Posts the corrected production for the Work Order in the amount specified.

section.title:
production
posting miscellaneous
miscellaneous production
posting of Post Miscellaneous Production
section.para: In repetitive manufacturing environments where production is continuous, the option to post miscellaneous production can be a useful feature. It can also be a useful feature for shops where disassembling manufactured Items is required. To post miscellaneous production, select the "Post Miscellaneous Production" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: If you want to disassemble a manufactured Item and return the component Items to Inventory, simply enter a negative quantity for the manufactured Item. Posting negative miscellaneous Production effectively reverses the Production process.

section.para: When posting miscellaneous production, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Item Number of the Item you want to post miscellaneous production for.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Specify Warehouse Location for selected Item.
to Post: Enter the quantity of production you want to post. This field will accept negative numbers for disassembly purposes.

Creates a user-defined reference for the miscellaneous production. The document number will be posted with the General Ledger (G/L) transaction record when the miscellaneous production is generated. This field may be used for internal tracking and auditing purposes.

Select to indicate that the material requirements indicated by the associated Work Order Material Requirement record should be issued to the selected Work Order regardless of the issue method associated with these requirements.

varlistentry.term: Issue Items not on Pick List

listitem.para: Select to indicate that non-Pick List Items should be backflushed as well.
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Comments related to the miscellaneous production posting.
Select to transfer miscellaneous production to specified Warehouse.
Specify the Warehouse you want to transfer production to.

note.para: Miscellaneous Production may not be posted for Breeder Items.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without posting the miscellaneous production, returning you to the application desktop.
Posts the production for the selected Item in the specified quantity.

section.title: W/O Operations
section.para: Work Order Operations can be created and managed in the W/O Operations section of the W/O Control area.

note.para: If your system is set to automatically explode Work Orders at creation, Work Order Operations will also be created automatically at explosion.

section.title: Create W/O Operation
section.para: To create a Work Order Operation, select the "Create W/O Operation" option. The following screen will appear:
When creating a Work Order Operation, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order you want to create an Operation for.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Indicates the next available Work Order Operations sequence number.

varlistentry.term:
execution days
in work orders
work orders
execution days in Execution Day

listitem.para: Select a number using the arrow buttons, or manually enter a value up to a maximum of 99. (Default is "1".)

Value entered defines when the specified Operation is to begin. For example, if the default value "1" is entered, the Operation will begin on the first day of the manufacturing process. If "2" is entered, the Operation will begin on the second day.
Displays the quantity ordered for the specified Item.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
: Select a Standard Operation to be used, if any.

You will notice that two separate description fields are available here. This makes it possible to isolate different categories of information onto separate lines. For example, the first line might contain an Item name, while the second line contains packaging information. Having these two types of information one above the other can serve as a kind of useful shorthand when viewing data in certain windows. However, these two lines will be concatenated (i.e., "joined together") when they are printed or presented in an on-line display format.
Specify a Work Center to be used for specified Operation.

varlistentry.term:
units of measure
in operations Production UOM

listitem.para: Select a Unit of Measure--or enter a free-form UOM.

Specify a UOM to be used optionally when Work Order Operations are posted for the specified Operation. Operations may be posted using either the Inventory or Production UOM. In addition, different Operations in a single Bill of Operations may use different Production UOMs. For example, if you are producing soup, you might mix the soup in one Operation using UOM = BATCH. But when canning the soup, the canning Operation might use UOM = CAN. If you post Operations using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded using the Inventory UOM.

note.para: When posting Work Order Operations, you are given the option to post Operations using Production UOMs or Inventory UOMs.

listitem.para: When Work Order Operations are posted using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded in the Inventory UOM.
Enter a tooling reference--if applicable.

note.para:
Labor and overhead
in w/o costing overhead Costs associated with setup and run times must be reported if they are to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. To report setup and run times, select the appropriate boxes in the Operation screen.

varlistentry.term:
setup time
in work orders
work orders
setup time for operations Total Setup Time

listitem.para: Setup Time: Amount entered represents the number of minutes required to set up the Work Center for the Operation.
Select to report setup time.
Must be selected for labor Costs associated with setup to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. If not selected, these Costs will not be reported.

varlistentry.term:
run time
in work orders
work orders
run time for operations Total Run Time

listitem.para: Run Time: Amount entered represents the total run time for the Operation measured in minutes.
Select to report run time.
Must be selected for labor Costs associated with run time to be tracked in the G/L and elsewhere. If not selected, these Costs will not be reported.

Indicates the number of units, in the given Item's Inventory UOM, that can be produced in a minute--and also the number of minutes that are required to produce 1 unit, expressed in the given Item's Inventory UOM.

varlistentry.term: Receive to Stock at this Operation

listitem.para: Select if you want finished goods to be received into Inventory when this Operation is posted.
Only one Work Order Operation may have this flag set. If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the finished goods being received into Inventory when the Operation is posted.

varlistentry.term: Auto. Issue Components at this Operation

listitem.para: Select if you want linked component material to be issued automatically (i.e., backflushed) when this Operation is posted.
If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the component materials being removed from Inventory when this Operation is posted.

note.para: The "Auto. Issue" setting applies only to component Items whose issue method is either "Pull" or "Mixed". Component Items using the "Push" issue method must be issued to Work Orders using a specific material issue transaction.

listitem.para: Displays setup time consumed.
Displays run time consumed.
Displays setup time remaining.
Displays run time remaining.
Selected if setup complete.
Selected if run complete.
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering instructions related to the Operation.
Select to display text in the "Instructions" field in fixed-width font.
This is a useful feature for displaying tables, matrixes, and other format-driven texts.

note.para: If copying formatted text from another application, formats may translate imperfectly.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without creating the Work Order Operation, returning you to the application desktop.
Creates the Work Order Operation.

section.title: Maintain W/O Operations
section.para: To maintain Work Order Operations, select the "Maintain W/O Operations" option. The following screen will appear:
When maintaining Work Order Operations, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose Operations you want to maintain.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Display lists Operations associated with specified Work Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Opens screen for creating a new Work Order Operation.

Enables you to edit highlighted Operations. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new Operation--except that when editing, the fields will contain Operation information based on definitions found in the Bill of Operations for the Item. Double-clicking on an Operation will also bring you to the editing screen.

tip.para: Use the edit feature to make temporary adjustments to the original Operation found in the specified Item's Bill of Operations. Any changes made here are valid for the life of the Work Order only. The original Bill of Operations is not affected.

listitem.para: Highlight an Operation and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight an Operation and then select this button to remove the Operation from the list.
Moves an Operation sequence up the Work Order Operations list.

Moving an Operation up or down the Work Order Operations list constitutes a production override. Changes made here do not affect the original Bill of Operations sequence. Sequence numbers, which are incremented in multiples of ten, are automatically adjusted to reflect the change in position.
Moves an Operation sequence down the Work Order Operations list.

Moving an Operation up or down the Work Order Operations list constitutes a production override. Changes made here do not affect the original Bill of Operations sequence. Sequence numbers, which are incremented in multiples of ten, are automatically adjusted to reflect the change in position.

section.para: Right-clicking on an Operation in the Operations list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title: Post Operations
section.para: Work Order progress can be posted in terms of materials used or Operations completed. When you post Operations, you are using the Operations-driven process for reporting progress. To post Work Order Operations, select the "Post Operations" option. The following screen will appear:
When posting a Work Order's Operations, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose Operations you want to post.
You may also scan into this field a Work Order Operation barcode as defined for the Shop Floor Workbench screen.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.

note.para: If your site combines Operations posting with WIP Location tracking for Multiple Location Control (MLC) Items, then you may be prompted to relocate Inventory during the Operations posting process.

listitem.para: Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select the individual Operation you want to post from the list of Work Order Operations for the specified Item.
After selecting an Operation, specify details for that Operation. To post Operations for another Operation, simply select that Operation from the sequential list.
Enter the quantity you want to post.

varlistentry.term:
work orders
posting options Post in Production UOMs

listitem.para: Select to post the Operations quantity in Production Units of Measure.

Operations may be posted using either the Inventory or Production UOM. In addition, different Operations in a single Bill of Operations may use different Production UOMs. For example, if you are producing soup, you might mix the soup in one Operation using UOM = BATCH. But when canning the soup, the canning Operation might use UOM = CAN. If you post Operations using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio defined at the Operation level normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded using the Inventory UOM.
Select to post the Operations quantity in Inventory Units of Measure.
Ordered: Indicates the quantity of material, measures in the Item's Inventory UOM, that the selected Work Order is due to produce.
Indicates the quantity, measured in the Item's Inventory UOM, that has been completed by this Operation.
Indicates the quantity remaining to be produced by the specified Operation.
Enter the name of the Work Center where the Operations were performed.
Indicates that linked component materials will be issued automatically (i.e., backflushed) when the specified Operation is posted.

Option will be enabled only if component materials are linked to the specified Operation within the parent Item's Bill of Materials. If such linkages exist, only components with "Pull" or "Mixed" issue methods will be displayed. Components having the "Push" issue method will not appear in the list, as these must be issued manually to a Work Order. If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the component materials being removed from Inventory when this Operation is posted.
Indicates that finished goods will be received into Inventory when the specified Operation is posted.

Enabled only when the selected Operation is the receiving Operation for the selected Work Order. Only one Work Order Operation may have this flag set. If this option is selected, the General Ledger will show the finished goods being received into Inventory when the Operation is posted.
Select to post setup time.
Select to mark setup as complete.
Select to post standard setup time.

Typically, standard times will not be used if Operations are being posted using the Shop Floor Workbench. Instead, labor times will be calculated based on clock-in and clock-out times. Only users with privileges to override the Production Time Clock will be able to post standard times.
Specify the non-standard amount of setup time required. The amount of time entered will be posted.
If you are posting Operations from the Shop Floor Workbench, the setup time entered will be automatically deducted from the run-time total.
Select to post run time.
Select to mark Operation as complete.
An Operation may not be marked as "Complete" until all users are clocked-out of the Operation. Users clock-in to and clock-out of Work Orders using the Shop Floor Workbench.
Select to post the standard run time for specified Item.

Typically, standard times will not be used if Operations are being posted using the Shop Floor Workbench. Instead, labor times will be calculated based on clock-in and clock-out times. Only users with privileges to override the Production Time Clock will be able to post standard times.
Specify the non-standard amount of run time required. The amount of time entered will be posted.
If you are posting Operations from the Shop Floor Workbench, run time will be automatically calculated based on the accumulated time elapsed between clock-ins and clock-outs.
Enter the name of the user who performed the set up.
Since this is a text field, user names may also be scanned into the field using a Bar Code scanner.
Enter the name of the user who performed the production run.
Since this is a text field, user names may also be scanned into the field using a Bar Code scanner.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without posting Operations, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to open the "Scrap Work Order Material from W/O" screen.
Posts the specified Operation using the values entered in the screen.

section.title: Correct Operations Posting
section.para: To correct a Work Order Operations posting, select the "Correct Operations Posting" option. The following screen will appear:
When correcting a Work Order Operations posting, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Work Order Number of the Work Order whose Operations posting you want to correct.
Displays Warehouse code automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Displays Item Number automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Work Order Status automatically when Work Order Number is entered into "Work Order #" field.
Select the individual Operation you want to post from the list of Work Order Operations for the specified Item.
After selecting an Operation, specify details for that Operation. To correct Operations posting for another Operation, simply select that Operation from the sequential list.
Enter the quantity you want to correct.

Select to post the corrected quantity in Production Units of Measure. Operations may be posted using either the Inventory or Production UOM. In addition, different Operations in a single Bill of Operations may use different Production UOMs. For example, if you are producing soup, you might mix the soup in one Operation using UOM = BATCH. But when canning the soup, the canning Operation might use UOM = CAN. If you post Operations using the Production UOM, the Inventory/Production UOM ratio defined at the Operation level normalizes the posting so that the Inventory impact is recorded using the Inventory UOM.
Select to post the corrected quantity in Inventory Units of Measure.
Ordered: Indicates the quantity of material, measures in the Item's Inventory UOM, that the selected Work Order is due to produce.
Indicates the quantity, measured in the Item's Inventory UOM, that has been completed by this Operation.
Indicates the quantity remaining to be produced by the specified Operation.

varlistentry.term:
components
at w/o posting Return Components

listitem.para: Components: Select to return components to the Work Order Material Requirements.
Option will only be enabled when Work Order Material Requirements are linked to a selected Operation. Only Items whose issue method is "Pull" or "Mixed" will be displayed.

varlistentry.term:
inventory
correcting operations posting Correct Inventory

listitem.para: Select of you wish to remove any Inventory issued to stock by the selected Operation.
Enabled if the selected Operation is tagged to receive Inventory.
Select to clear the setup complete flag.
Select to correct setup time.
Select to correct standard setup time.
Specify the non-standard amount of setup time used. The amount of time entered will be corrected.
Select to clear the Operation as complete flag.
Select to correct run time.
Select to correct the standard run time for specified Item.
Specify the non-standard amount of run time used. The amount of time entered will be corrected.
The amount of time entered will be posted.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without posting Operations, returning you to the application desktop.
Posts the specified Operation using the values entered in the screen.

section.title: W/O Reports
section.para: Manufacturing reports are contained in this section.
